text.text_translated:
A hula hoop is a big plastic ring. You can move it around your body.
When Wasfia Nazreen was a young girl, she saw a hula hoop. A child from another country was playing with it. The child was visiting Wasfia's country, Bangladesh. Wasfia watched. She was sad because she could not play. In her country, people believed girls should not play with hula hoops. They also believed girls should not ride bikes.
Now, Wasfia is a famous woman. She climbed the seven highest mountains in the world. For example, she climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro. Not many people have done this. She did something special on the top of each mountain. She was the first person to play with a hula hoop there.
She did this to show women and girls they can be strong. In Bangladesh, society tells girls that sports are not for them. Wasfia wants to change this idea.
